message: Hey guys, I am in a post of 4th of July family get together, I won't be able to make it today but I have written contingency for risk assessment
I will push it later tonight or tomorrow
Also I have updated use case model also written description for it so please let me know if there is any changes guys
Happy 4th, enjoy!!!
Pushed my latest Proto.

I was able to finally implement fragments - actually I copied from Android tutorial from googles developer website.  I left the class names the same on one fragment incase you want to follow against the tutorial to understand.  We will change the names once you guys understand how it works.
just pulled it.
Adding a new VIP is available in the VIP activity using the login button - kind of roundabout but will fix it next revision.
I just pulled it as well, I'lll go ahead and try it out in just a moment ;-)
Did you get a chance to look at the tests I put?  Are those reasonable tests?

I have spent over two days just coding this - so there is a lot of clean up I could not get to.  But the good news is we are very close to a beta also so next week is easy sailing. Play with it and let me know.
Tony - did not check out the tests.
I've still yet to bea ble to run the project as loaded.  I tried making a new project, then copying the files to it, but it still runs the "Hello World" screen.

Since I hogged the coding on this project I would like to give you guys an opportunity take this to next level with me as support.  As I said in the commit comment its kind of crude and needs lot of polishing and improvement in user interface.
Hello world - I dont have that screen anywhere.  Did you try importing the project rather than copying.
@TonyPotter I was able to get the new up and running ok
It does look a bit different than the initial one from last week
I tried.  @OmarRamos  can you give me a step-by-step how you did it?
i tried from @MuraliRaju but it still runs the default Hello World screen when you create a project.
I imported over it but it's still not working.
Starting a new clone is the best way to get over the issues.

On my end I had the same project-02 folder where I had checked out a fresh copy of the team repo the other week. For this week I have it checked out to the Deliverable2 branch so when I saw Murali had posted the update I just pulled in the changes (I already have my local eclipse workspace setup to show that project so that updated automatically and I just went ahead and tried running it as an Android App at that point and the updated one came through). I did have GenyMotion closed down during this time though, so I had to open up the emulator fresh before running the Android App.
ok got a clean clone
I did not use GenyMotion.
Just ADK.

That part shouldn't matter necessarily (I just mentioned it since for the other android assignment, leaving GenyMotion open over a long period would cause it to behave weird so I'd need to close it and restart it and it would respond normally again)
I will check for a moment will be back in 10.
i can see all the code, I just can' trun  it.
So the project is open in eclipse and everything? But when you hit Run as Android App, it doesn't actually do anything? Or it deploys an incorrect app?
It shows the "Hello World" screen.
under the Coffee Cart package
So you have a HellowWorldActivity.java fil;e in the edu.gatech.coffeecart package?
no.
Hmm...I wonder where it's picking it up from
I had tried what Murali originally recommended
to creat ea new project, then copy the files onto it, replacing the original files.
did that work?
no.
I don't have a helloworld anywhere.
you don't.  it's from the default project I built
you told me to create a new project, then copy the files onto it.
But you already deleted it?
overwriting MainActivity and creating the other Activities in that folder.
Did you do a project>clean

let me try project/clean
ok, i have a running (well, greyed out) application that looks right.
Copying files is not a good ...
On a separate note, was the Initial Desigin Model intended to be a document, or simply this newest version of the application?
@TonyPotter Awesome ;-)
Best to try new workspace new clone and import project from the clone.
Let eclipse create new project that way.
my success with git has been less than present lately.
but it's working now
Design got modified a little - will have to update design doc.
brb
I want Tony to review proto before we go any further.
i've run through a few simulations, the customer numbers are five digits, i've ordered a few coffees and desserts
pre-ordering doesn't seem to do anything yet.
but i've checked out and gotten the pop up
it looks pretty good!
so when I check out it always goes to 10001 customer number?
I'm a little confused by the UI, but as Murali mentioned it still needs some work
It seems intuitive to me.
+ to deal with a new customer
Where are you seeing the Pre-Order option in the UI? Or is that only in the code part?
Under Dessert - long press bring up three options - buy, Pre-order, and Nutrition facts.
if I select buy then checkout cart, I get the message that my chosen item is "purchased"
butfor preorders, checkout does nothing.
Go ahead and post the issues; I will do the quickfixes.
Preorder needs fixing.

Since all of the actions have been incorporated into the bottom activity bar area, maybe making the main screen an area where the current customer/cart information can be listed would make it a little easier to use
I enter number 10003, then select a coffee, and when I checkout, it's applied to 10001.
on checkout, the purchase list doesn't seem to clear, but continues to grow.
if you enter a new customer number and make a new purchase, it's added to the original purchase with the first customer number entered.
it would be nice if there was a screen response to entering a new customer number, like perhaps showing the first and last name of the customer so the salesperson could address them by name.

@TonyPotter I think that could be covered with the change I mentioned above...I really feel like we need that main screen to contain the current customer / cart information (and possibly move Checkout / Clear Cart options into there and out of the bottom Activity Bar if we do that)
agreed.
The PayPal Here app is kind of what I'm thinking of in my head: https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.paypal.here&referrer=utm_fiksu_adid%3D187736%26
(Mainly the Items listing the 2nd screenshot on the page above) with the total shown for the selected items (and then we can additional show Customer info above that)
yep.
For the proto we will just fix the non working items.
New features for beta.
Right?
yah.
it seems to me if you enter a new customer number, it shoudl clear the cart.  What do you think?
Yup I agree
Otherwise it makes it difficult to start with the next person
so do we really need a clear cart button then?
since each new customer clears the cart?
if a customer changes their mind and doesn't make a purchase, we just wait until the next customer gives their number
and that clears the cart.
I think the Clear Cart is intended for those situations where a customer says they want this and this, but then change their mind around and end up wanting that and that
(or employee typo, incorrectly selecting something)
This is fun...watching you guys figure it out.
glad we can amuse you Murali :)
Kind of like watching users...interact with program.
Manage VIP and View report say "Use similar button" but there is no similar button.
Should be under the ... on the right hand side
right, but they don't show up
they're under the ... but it's not intuitive
I agree, but I think we'll get that sorted out
I'm going to need to leave soon, so is there anything else we need to discuss before tomorrow?

So what's our current next step? It sounded like Chandra was going to go ahead and put in a few updates later tonight/early tomorrow. Murali mentioned an update to the Design Model and it sounded like he also wanted to interegrate any bug fixes we mentioned here in our current review.
Will we be doing any major additions for this week to the code, or will we leave that for the upcoming week?
I'm thinking what we have is a great "Alpha" to show functionality
I'll need to type up a software hierarchy, which I can do now that I have a running version.
I've already submitted the updated project plan and test suites
That's right the software arch. document was also needed
Yup yup
that's what we added on Thursday rigth?
so If Murali can look at the test suites, tell me what we need to tweak on there for Deliverable3
The main screen was for you guys not intended for users we will have a manual.\n
right.  Not a problem.  It's working well.
So I'll type up Software Architecture Document and post later tonight or tomorrow.
We can meet tomorrow same bat time to disucss what we need for D3?
Sure
And for submitting Deliverable2
right.
I can go ahead and do that once all of the documents are set tomorrow?
excellent.  Until then, then?
OK.
Gnite.
Feel free to keep me posted on any document updates (using @OmarRamos) and I'll try and get Deliverable2 submitted as soon as we're good to go tomorrow
Have a good night guys and Good work @MuraliRaju ;-)
will do. nite!
@OmarRamos just pushed the RevisedRiskAssessment with a mitigation plan for each, please let me know if you guys have any questions. Will talk to guys later tonight :)
@ChandraSapkota Nice work! This should be good to mark as final ;-)
@TonyPotter: Checked the test cases - I see a lot of UI features that need to be implemented if we use the test cases for coding.  I am OK if you guys have the patience for more coding...
We will have to review it in detail because the test cases kind of imply more requirements...
Example - monthly reports.
My thinking is we will have our hands full just implementing the core functionality.
Somebody tell me what a Design Model is?
@MuraliRaju Perhaps that is something like our previous assignment using ArgoUML ?
I'm not sure if Tony has any thoughts on it
So the UML wont be a part of Architecture document then?
@TonyPotter That's what I'm not sure about, I'm hoping Tony might have a bit more insight

@MuraliRaju Here's some info on the Design Document:\nhttps://piazza.com/class/huy90hs4g9g3jq?cid=545\nFrom Professor Orso: "I think there is a difference between initial design model and initial design document. The design model should be like a class diagram where you clearly show the classes involved and how they are related."
@TonyPotter I'm not sure if my comment above to Murali may tie in with what's being done with the Software Architecture document or not, but it might be useful to you as well, so just FYI.
